China hasn’t lived up to their end of the Phase One trade deal.

They’ve fallen $16 billion short on the purchases they promised to make from American farmers.

It’s time for President Biden to enforce the deal and hold China accountable. https://t.co/rkgafrZf8q

Glad to see work underway on getting a lot of these bridges replaced in North Missouri through the FARM Bridge and Focus on Bridges programs.
 
Thank you to @GovParsonMO and @MoDOT for all your work on this! 
https://t.co/9ldoufXrH7

The USPS is a critical lifeline for millions of Americans. 

I’m proud to support bipartisan legislation to put the Postal Service back on solid ground so they can keep delivering for generations of Americans to come. https://t.co/BysrWtu9E0

I’m proud to introduce the Equal Access to Therapeutics Act with @RodneyDavis. 

No American should be denied access to COVID-19 treatments based on the color of their skin. https://t.co/iOFGsTCJny

A lot has changed in American agriculture over the last hundred years, but one thing hasn’t changed. Farming in America is a family business. It always has been and, if I’ve got any say, it always will be. https://t.co/M6XlgmJQYc

The supply chain is a mess.

Our economy is in turmoil.

Transportation Committee Members haven’t heard yet from the Administration about how they’re going to fix this crisis.

That’s why I’ve asked the Administration to come and lay out a coherent plan. https://t.co/Xkg3M78yTV

I just voted against Pelosi’s America CONCEDES Act because it:

❌Fails to hold China accountable
❌Sends $8 billion to a UN climate slush fund
❌Gives China more opportunities to steal our intellectual property

Congress should be putting America first, not China.

Be safe and only drive if you absolutely have to.

You can get up-to-date information on road conditions around the state at: https://t.co/8m7YV45ZWw https://t.co/Vkgi4nWsvU

Well, it’s Groundhog Day again.

There’s still a crisis at our southern border.

and...

President Biden still hasn’t done anything to fix it.

This is a must-read from @MOFarmBureau President Garrett Hawkins. 

He absolutely hit the nail on the head. 

The Biden EPA’s attempt to rewrite the definition of Waters of the United States is nothing more than a power grab. https://t.co/kQoSdXaFlE
Congratulations to Col. John Cluck, the entire @139AW, Rosecrans Memorial Airport Manager Abe Forney, and everyone who helped make the @SOSairshow a huge success in 2021! https://t.co/80OBnjh0Fu

Today is the 77th anniversary of the liberation of Auschwitz.
 
On International Holocaust Remembrance day, we should all take time to remember the victims of the Holocaust and work towards ensuring nothing like this ever happens again. https://t.co/MsSIn6i1aS

Members need to know exactly what the administration is doing with IIJA funding and protect against waste, fraud & abuse. 

We need to make sure we aren’t repeating the same mistakes made during the implementation of the 2009 Recovery Act. https://t.co/ioJ1u7pz96

Farmers need clear rules.
 
We don’t need a bunch of bureaucrats telling us how to run our farms.
 
If the Biden EPA wants a return to Obama-era WOTUS overreach, they at least need to stop and listen to the farmers and small business owners it will impact. https://t.co/iWPR4BLd5P

The Biden Administration is trying to avoid input from farmers and small business owners to rush Obama-era WOTUS overreach back from the dead. 

At the very least, they need to stop and listen to the folks it will impact. https://t.co/CAV4JREPMA
I’m eager to see work start on more of the 29 weight-restricted one-line bridges slated to be replaced under the FARM Bridge program and I’m excited to see what the future holds for our state.
Thanks to their efforts, we’ve replaced countless bridges across the state of Missouri under the Focus on Bridges program.

I was proud to secure more than $100 million in federal funding in 2019 to get these programs going, but it wouldn’t have been possible without the leadership of Governor Parson and all the work MoDOT has put into this.
I’d like to give a big thanks to @GovParsonMO and @MODOT for their partnership on the FARM Bridge Program and the Focus on Bridges Program. #MOLeg
My bill will put our rural hospitals back on solid ground so they can continue serving as a lifeline for our communities. https://t.co/BgxXPBW7Oc
BREAKING: The Supreme Court has BLOCKED President Biden’s unconstitutional vaccine mandate for private employers with more than 100 employees.
Our rural hospitals are in a crisis. That’s why I’ve teamed up with @RepHuffman to introduce the Save America’s Rural Hospitals Act to put them back on solid ground. https://t.co/SRK6NHE4nD

Inflation cost the average American family $3,500 last year and many expect it to be worse this year. 

The President’s out-of-control spending spree is only making this problem worse. 

We have to stop it. https://t.co/eLkhjwr3p0
When it comes to federal regulations, farmers need certainty. The EPA needs to stop changing the rules and let farmers run their own farms. https://t.co/R2P3Xygo7k

Glad to see work has started on replacing the first 3 bridges under the FARM Bridge Program. 
 
I was proud to secure federal funding in 2019 to launch this program to replace 31 bridges and I'm grateful for all the work @GovParsonMO & @MODOT have done to make it possible.

Vaccine mandates are wrong. 

Getting a COVID-19 vaccine ought to be a personal choice.

It shouldn't be mandated by the federal government. https://t.co/6TJ0d8MwsR
I’m proud to announce this year’s nominations of North Missouri students to attend U.S. Military Academies. https://t.co/sCsfEcBywa

Vaccines work. Vaccine mandates are wrong.

You shouldn’t be required to get a COVID-19 vaccine to work, travel, or live in this country.

It ought to be a personal decision.

The new Highway 15 bridge north of Memphis is now open! I was proud to work with President Trump and @GovParsonMO to help secure an $81.2 million INFRA grant to replace this bridge and 45 other bridges across rural Missouri. https://t.co/DcuZu34bCS
You shouldn’t need a vaccine passport to get on a train, board a plane, or travel home for the holidays. @RepWebster and I introduced a bill to make sure that never happens. https://t.co/GizWn2AQ3K
Strong winds across North Missouri today. Be careful out there! https://t.co/Qyd2whIhMD
Vaccine passports are a terrible idea. @RepWebster and I introduced legislation to ban vaccine mandates for travel. https://t.co/cEI6SsHAUM

I fought hard to reverse cuts in the FY22 NDAA that would have cost hundreds of jobs in Jackson County. 

Now I’m working to make sure this vital funding gets appropriated next year. https://t.co/qYzKGZ4Am1

We just gave Amtrak roughly $60 billion in new funding. 

Now they’re talking about cutting service due to vaccine mandates. 

Unbelievable. https://t.co/eaY8dkaaS4

Inflation just hit a 39 year high.

Food prices drove a big part of that increase last month. Gas has already gone through the roof.

This isn’t a “high-class problem.” This is a real problem for working Americans. 

The President needs to stop his spending spree now.

Amtrak just got about $60 billion in new funding, but now President Biden’s vaccine mandates are spurring new worker shortages and service cuts, thwarting recovery from historic Amtrak losses last year. Taxpayers will be paying more money for less service.
I’m proud to support this year’s NDAA, which gives our troops a much deserved pay raise. https://t.co/OGQGGRUJ1o

Work continues of the Buck O’Neil Bridge Replacement project. I was proud to secure a $25 million BUILD grant for the project in 2018 and glad to see @MoDOT break ground on it this summer. Excited to see the new bridge in December 2024! https://t.co/PVaRBoCA2S

Take some time to read this. With each passing year, stories like Seaman 1st Class David Russell’s are becoming harder and harder to come by. May we never forget the service and sacrifice of the Greatest Generation. https://t.co/P4zuHCI36n
Remember Pearl Harbor. https://t.co/bUFjaOtbom

As then Chair of the House Subcommittee on Highways, I was proud to secure a $25 million BUILD grant in 2018 to make the Buck O’Neil Bridge replacement project a reality. @MODoT broke ground this summer and it’s slated to be completed in December 2024. https://t.co/kB6fkvfzzA

That’s why I introduced a Congressional Review Act resolution to reject Biden’s OSHA vaccine mandate and it’s why I’m working to stop the Biden Administration from strong-arming healthcare employers into firing their employees.

CMS has suspended enforcement of the vaccine mandate for healthcare workers.
 
This is a big win. Nobody should have to choose between getting a COVID-19 vaccine or losing their job—especially not our healthcare heroes. https://t.co/zkNCi7Gm7m

If an 18 year-old can drive a semi-truck in a war zone, they ought to be able to drive one on the interstate. Given the current supply chain crisis, there’s no better time to let 18-21 year-olds apply to get their CDL. https://t.co/T2t8TthcEU
FEMA needs fixing. We’re making some great bipartisan progress to hold FEMA accountable for their mistakes and get folks the help they need after disasters. https://t.co/rMqw2jI0jz

We shouldn’t rely on Russia and OPEC for our oil.
 
America needs to be energy independent.
 
President Biden needs to get on board or get out of the way.
 
Until he does, we’re all going to be paying higher prices at the pump.

President Biden is begging Russia and OPEC to sell us more oil.

Respectfully, Mr. President, we don’t need more oil from Russia or the Middle East. We need more American oil. We need to be energy independent again. 

Stop standing in the way.
This year’s Thanksgiving is slated to be the most expensive on record and the President’s spending spree is only making this inflation crisis worse. https://t.co/V3bEyyj3od

Instead he’s begging OPEC and Russia to sell us more oil.

Ridiculous.

The President announced today he’ll release 3 days’ worth of oil from the strategic petroleum reserve.

This won’t make gas cheaper at the pump.

The real solution to bringing down gas prices = stop shutting down American pipelines and stifling domestic oil production.

Inflation is up.
 
Prices have gone through the roof.
 
Instead of passing the buck, the President needs to stop his out-of-control spending spree and end his ridiculous mandates. 
 
His policies are making this crisis worse. https://t.co/3na0hRKOmV
I voted against President Biden’s massive spending spree. Read my full statement here: https://t.co/TVUUEOB9Yz
This action to repeal the Trump Administration's Navigable Waters Protection Rule is the next step in their pre-determined, partisan plan that will only make things worse, not better.
We have known since June that they planned to re-impose an onerous WOTUS definition on farmers, small businesses, infrastructure builders, local utilities and regular citizens.
This is another example of how this Administration is actively making it harder to improve infrastructure and address the supply chain crisis. https://t.co/Kx8l48Ci7p

The President’s policies are making the supply chain crisis worse.
 
They’re making the inflation crisis worse.
 
He needs to recognize that, “step up,” and start working to fix it.
 
We can’t afford to let this problem keep growing. https://t.co/AF0Xp2JJmq

No American should have to choose between getting a shot or losing their job.

That's why I introduced a Congressional Review Act resolution with many of my colleagues today to stop Biden’s vaccine mandate. https://t.co/j187echqjC

Inflation is out of control.
 
Rising prices have gone through the roof.
 
Biden’s spending spree is only going to make it worse.
 
American families can’t afford that. They can barely afford to keep up.
 
We have to stop this spending spree before it’s too late.

This massive spending spree is going to make inflation worse and send rising prices through the roof.

American families can’t afford that. https://t.co/mEvsgNBaZB

The pipeline is already built.

It’s already bringing natural gas to 650,000 Missouri households and businesses.

Shutting it down could leave many without heat for up to 100 days, right at the start of winter.

It must remain open. https://t.co/4yoxE1ufCS

.@RepBlaine is right. This problem isn’t temporary or “transitory” like we were told. Small businesses are getting shellacked by skyrocketing inflation—and Biden’s massive spending spree is only making it worse. We have to stop it. https://t.co/sjUOOyqihr
Thank you to all who have served and sacrificed to protect this country we call home! https://t.co/VD9gnCbufp

Gas is almost $1.35 more expensive in Missouri than it was this time last year. 
 
The New York Times is already projecting this to be the most expensive Thanksgiving ever. 
 
We need to slam the brakes on President Biden’s massive spending spree before this crisis gets worse.
We owe an incredible debt of gratitude to all our Marines who have served and sacrificed to keep our country free. Thank you and happy birthday, Marines! https://t.co/QkQPFxPvxm

Anybody who has been to the gas station or the grocery store lately could have told you that.

Rising prices and inflation are out of control. 

We have to stop President Biden’s spending spree—which threatens to make this nightmare even worse. https://t.co/KNAOSwtTMx
These vaccine mandates are threatening to shut down entire sectors of our economy virtually overnight. We can’t afford that. https://t.co/myGI63z92X

Biden doesn’t think Americans “understand” the supply chain crisis.

Does he even understand it?

Because his socialist policies and mandates are making it worse.

The American people understand that we’re sick of it.

Quit playing politics and fix it. https://t.co/gzoMVQTCSp

My bill to expand internet access by cutting red tape has passed the House of Representatives. 

The E-BRIDGE Act will unlock existing EDA funds to let communities use those dollars to complete last mile internet infrastructure projects. https://t.co/llJUEyKMYG

Having reliable internet access isn’t a luxury anymore, it’s a necessity—whether you need it for school, work, healthcare, or farming. 

My bill will unlock existing federal programs to help communities complete last-mile internet infrastructure projects. https://t.co/FbkkLvJj1O

The President is trying to strong-arm American companies into firing essential workers who risked their lives working through the darkest days of the pandemic. That's not right. https://t.co/KKNb9IBCT6

The federal government shouldn’t be mandating American businesses fire workers for failing to comply or face massive fines. 

This is only going to make the supply chain crisis worse. https://t.co/DAtSOBjpQ5

Biden promised to shut down the virus.

Instead, he’s trying to shut down our economy.

He helped create this supply chain crisis and this vaccine mandate is going to make it worse.

Getting a COVID vaccine is a personal choice, not a choice for politicians in DC to make for you.

The supply chain crisis has gotten out of control—and the mandates coming out of DC are only making things worse. 
 
We’ve heard Biden say American businesses need to  “step up,” but the reality is the President needs to “step up” for American businesses. 
https://t.co/tX0GrSWPFt

The President blames high gas prices on OPEC.
 
He blames the supply chain crisis on COVID.
 
He says private businesses need to “step up” to fix his mess.
 
In Missouri, we call that passing the buck. It doesn’t fly around here.
 
The President is the one who needs to step up.
You won’t hear about it on the nightly news, but my bipartisan legislation to fix some of the major problems at FEMA is moving forward. This is a big win for disaster victims. https://t.co/Vkf5oWbMz1

If you still don’t think you’re going to end up footing the bill for President Biden’s spending spree, I’ve got some great oceanfront property for sale in Missouri you might be interested in. https://t.co/8xsusNrDfy

The Biden Administration wants to pay some illegal immigrants $450,000.

When a servicemember is killed in action, their next of kin gets $50,000 less than that.

This is outrageous. I joined my colleagues today calling on the Biden Administration to drop this terrible plan. https://t.co/TiZvvdpwWm

The problem with the supply chain crisis is the Administration’s policies.

When you throw in extended unemployment benefits and arbitrary vaccine mandates, that just creates all kinds of logistical problems.

The President needs to step up and back off these regulatory burdens. https://t.co/PyLlskBbF0

The IRS surveillance scheme will scoop up data on every American that spends just $28 per day. 

We have to stop this massive invasion of our privacy, which is why I helped introduce the Prohibiting IRS Financial Surveillance Act. https://t.co/ljdMpTKcxV

The Biden IRS’s surveillance scheme will scoop up private banking data for every American that spends just $28 per day. Millions of blue-collar workers and middle-class families will get caught up in it. That isn’t by mistake, it’s by design. We have to stop them. https://t.co/p4KqqXpyHM

I introduced two bills to cut through the red tape at FEMA and help communities impacted by disasters.

Mr. President,
 
We have to address the global supply chain crisis before Congress considers your radical tax-and-spend agenda that’s making matters even worse.
 
This crisis isn’t going to go away if you keep pretending it isn’t happening. https://t.co/2vU1Z2ZL8T

Small communities often face huge bureaucratic barriers when trying to get help from FEMA after a disaster. I introduced bipartisan legislation today to cut through the red tape and help communities rebuild faster. https://t.co/ja9WSRY2h3

I am deeply saddened to learn of the passing of former Secretary of State Colin Powell. My prayers are with his family and friends struggling with this devastating loss. https://t.co/scjS6kFGUn

Today is National Farmers Day. To the men and women that feed America, thank you! https://t.co/eXFZFjTCyi
The Biden IRS has no business spying on Americans’ private financial records. They need to stay out of our bank accounts. https://t.co/lOgAs8w9yq

In @FDRLST today: These mandates are a step too far. Getting a COVID-19 vaccine is a personal choice. Why is POTUS trying to get airlines employees fired, especially after they just helped bring Americans home during his botched Afghanistan retreat?

Forty percent of breast cancer survivors will develop lymphedema—a life-long, chronic, and potentially debilitating disease requiring daily management. I’m proud to cosponsor the #LymphedemaTreatmentAct. Together we can and will find a cure. #BreastCancerAwarenessMonth https://t.co/YtrVXyvdCD
Today is National Manufacturing Day. Thank you to all our incredible manufacturers and manufacturing workers that make it possible make things in America!
Glad to join @RAAtweets' 2021 Leaders Conference to discuss @TransportGOP's work on infrastructure and the important issues facing our nation's regional airports. https://t.co/8ybwQHQVM4

Our economy can’t function without truckers. We need to give them the support they need to get the job done—including more places to park while they’re on the road so they can rest safely. https://t.co/Df5x9wuSXf

That’s why I supported bringing up the Border Security for America Act this week to finally give our Border Patrol agents the tools they need to get the job done—including a completed border wall. https://t.co/RJ8js1VPbA

I was proud to support this year’s NDAA, which invests in our national defense, demands a full accounting of what the President left behind in Afghanistan, and requires the DOD to develop a plan to bring every American home.

I voted against raising the debt limit yesterday. We can’t mortgage our children’s future to finance Speaker Pelosi’s $3.5 trillion tax and spend plan.
What an incredibly powerful story. May we never forget Officer Madrid-Evans’ sacrifice and service to our community. https://t.co/rGVjpzhQP0

It’s National Farm Safety Week. As we head into harvest season, please be on the lookout for slow-moving farm vehicles on the roadways. One split-second glance away from the road could cost you your life, and cost a family their loved one. Please slow down and pay attention.

This shouldn’t be that hard. Our transportation dollars shouldn’t be used to enforce vaccine mandates. https://t.co/fXO6U8wEtl

It’s only going to fuel more inflation, taxing middle-class working families struggling to get by. https://t.co/KG3YPUNlQ3

It’s all a massive tax on the middle class.

On this day and every day, may we remember those taken from us that day, 

may we remember the heroes that risked everything to save others, 

and may we remember those that served and sacrificed to keep us safe. 

May we #NeverForget https://t.co/7yZzsGWdhY
#NeverForget https://t.co/EPQ1wIlh3E

Biden’s mandates are getting out of control.
 
He wants to dictate what everyday Americans do at their job, but he can’t even manage to do his own job.
Quite frankly, it seems like a desperate attempt to distract from his disgraceful bungling of the withdrawal of U.S. troops from Afghanistan.
I strongly oppose President Biden’s vaccine mandate for private businesses and their employees. This is just the latest example of the extreme executive overreach by this Administration.

We will never forget the tragedy of 9/11/2001.

We will never forget the 13 servicemembers killed on 8/26/2021.

We will never forget.
Welcome home, Lance Corporal Schmitz. May we never forget your sacrifice. https://t.co/EvwDTFodcC
Our words can never repay their ultimate sacrifice, but we should remember their courage and our actions should honor their service. https://t.co/UbkPfKep8e

President Biden left Americans stranded behind enemy lines in Afghanistan. 

That’s unacceptable. 

We don’t leave people behind.
Thank you for helping our fellow Americans in this time of need. May God bless you and protect you in your efforts.

I want to say a quick word of thanks to all those heading from North Missouri to help with Hurricane Ida relief—to National Guard soldiers, electrical linemen, members of Missouri Task Force 1, and others.

It’s always difficult when we lose a service member, but it’s heartbreaking when such tragedy strikes so close to home.
  
Please join me in uplifting the Page family in your prayers. May we never forget his service and ultimate sacrifice.

This is Corporal Daegan Page—one of thirteen American servicemembers killed in the terrorist attack in Kabul, Afghanistan. He was 23 years old.
 
Cpl. Page grew up in Red Oak, Iowa, and went to school in Omaha, Nebraska. His father, Greg, is from Tarkio, Missouri. https://t.co/qPZ27cwQMI

Bring every American home.

Bring all our allies home.

Leave no man behind.

We cannot blindly trust the Taliban to return Americans and our allies home safely.
Never Forget. https://t.co/YlzyTG7rsj

May we never forget his sacrifice. Please keep Lance Corporal Schmitz's family, friends, and loved ones in your prayers.
